sub_title: Entrepreneur, Impact Investor, Startup Ecosystem builder, Lecturer Business Studies, Speaker, Climate Innovation Advocate & Serial Founder of things. Cleantech is my passion
summary:
Ahmed Larouz is a social innovator, lecturer, entrepreneur and a strategic creative communication and marketing manager. He's founder of Africa Incubator, Diwan Awards Holland and also the co-founder and Author of 180 Amsterdammers celebrating Amsterdam's rich cultures and for being the most diverse city in the world. 
Lecturer at InHolland University of Applied Sciences (Business Studies) Amsterdam. Gained experience across several industries around the globe and has consulted commercial businesses, start-ups, government and social organizations. 
Also the Morocco Lead and chair of the ClimateLaunchpad which is the world’s largest green
business ideas competition. Our mission is to unlock the world’s cleantech potential that addresses climate change. Founded Bridgizz, a communication and marketing agency based in Amsterdam with a satellite office in Casablanca (Morocco). 

* Prior to that he co-founded and owned a Consultancy Company Mexit on Diversity Management and Communication. He was active in the fields of diversity business, diversity marketing and communication, recruitment, training and coaching for more than 20 years. Ahmed is also pro-active and developed innovative and creative initiatives concerning social cohesion, social innovation and entrepreneurship in different countries.. 

* He is also the founding father of diverse networks including INCLEADERS: The Dutch Inclusion Leaders Network, The Cedar Network  (Europe’s First Diaspora Leaders Network), TANS (President 2000-2006) a network of highly educated immigrants. Also he acted as Board member of various organizations as CINEBLEND Film Festival (chair of The first Anthropology & Diversity film festival in the world), Rabobank, Morocco Fund (Co-founder and vice-president). He is also a founding member of different entrepreneurs networks. 

Ahmed has also invented, initiated and organized Ramadan Festival. The first of its kind in the western world. He has implemented this approach in different cities through the globe. He launched it in London, Lausanne, Belgium and  Norway.

These days I split my time between Brussels and Amsterdam ..

school.name: De Haagse Hogeschool / The Hague University of Applied Sciences

awards.title: Marshall Memorial Fellow
awards.description:
Selected as European Marshall Memorial Fellow.
Conducted in Washington, D.C, New Orelans and Baton Rouge (LA), Pierre (South Dakota), Seattle (WA) and New York City

Founded in 1982, the Marshall Memorial Fellowship (MMF) was created to introduce a new generation of European leaders to the United States with a companion program launched in 1999 to expose future U.S. leaders to a changing and expanding Europe. The Marshall Memorial Fellowship provides a unique opportunity for emerging leaders from the United States and Europe to explore institutions, politics, and culture on the other side of the Atlantic. American and European Fellows each visit five cities during the 24-day program. They meet formally and informally with a range of policymakers, prominent community members, and local MMF alumni.
awards.issuer: German Marshall Fund of the United States

awards.title: International Visitor Leadership Program
awards.description: The International Visitor Leadership Program (IVLP) is the U.S. Department of State’s premier professional exchange program. Through short-term visits to the United States, current and emerging foreign leaders in a variety of fields experience this country firsthand and cultivate lasting relationships with their American counterparts

Entrepreneur, Impact Investor, Startup Ecosystem builder, Lecturer Business Studies, Speaker, Climate Innovation Advocate & Serial Founder of things. Cleantech is my passion

profile_positions.description:
Bridgizz is an Amsterdam-based global Communication, Marketing and Design company with a satellite office in Casablanca (Morocco), operating globally. 

Bridgizz offers the following services:
- Strategic management Consulting
- Communication & Marketing
- Design & Digital Media
- Branding
- Business Development in MENA and Africa
- Recruitment
profile_positions.title: CEO

profile_positions.description:
Climovation is a dynamic organization dedicated to advancing sustainability and climate-focused initiatives. Our agency specializes in providing consultancy services to government agencies, corporate industries, and NGOs, guiding them on climate, sustainability, innovation, and entrepreneurship matters from initial strategy to successful implementation. We operate internationally, running diverse programs in various countries.

Our core mission is to foster green entrepreneurship and drive innovation in clean technology. We are passionate about motivating and mobilizing individuals and organizations, establishing valuable connections, and igniting a spirit of green entrepreneurship. To achieve this, we offer comprehensive cleantech programs that cover ideation, incubation, acceleration, and innovation.

At Climovation, we strongly advocate for the integration of acclaimed international programs that promote open innovation and contribute to the development of sustainable ecosystems. Through strategic partnerships, we facilitate access to funding and investors, empowering our network to achieve their sustainability goals.

Our portfolio of cleantech programs includes ClimateLaunchpad, Climathon, and ClimAccelerator, all designed to nurture innovative ideas and solutions. As a proud member of the esteemed EIT Climate-KIC family, which boasts a decade-long track record in climate innovation, we are committed to amplifying cleantech entrepreneurship on local, regional, national, and global levels.
profile_positions.title: Founder and CEO

profile_positions.description: ClimateLaunchpad is the world’s largest green business ideas competition currently active in 56 countries. We are launching the competition in Morocco for the first time. Fixing climate change, one start up at a time! www.climatelaunchpad.org
profile_positions.title: Founder ClimateLaunchpad Morocco

A New platform promoting Investements and  stimulating doing business towards Morocco. Exploring limitless opportunities, build strategic bond with Moroccan business network.
www.doingbusinessinmorocco.COM
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description:
ASATT is founded by Youssef Kobo and grew up from nothing to one of the largest networks of young bicultural professionals in Belgium with chapters in The Netherlands and UK. 
ASATT offers mentoring and leadership programs in collaboration with our corporate partners. We organize weekly events, CEO roundtables, trainings, study trips and activities to sharpen young people’s professional skills, self-reliance and entrepreneurial spirit. And of course a seat at the table with diverse leaders and change makers.
profile_positions.title: Managing Partner

profile_positions.description: Business Studies: Entrepreneurship, Innovation Management, Entrepreneurial Behavior, Marketing, International Management and Cross cultural Management
profile_positions.title: Lecturer

profile_positions.description: The Inclusion Leaders Network (INCLEADERS) is an inclusive leadership network for diverse leaders. Incleaders is inspired by the Transatlantic Inclusion Leaders Network (TILN) of The German Marshall Fund, and works to support diverse talent and inclusive decision-making across the Netherlands through knowledge and information sharing, leadership development, and connecting emerging and established leaders.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description:
In 2016, the city of Amsterdam celebrates its diversity by mapping all of the 180 nationalities that live within its boundaries, photographing and listening to the stories of representatives from each of these groups, from the 12,354 Brits to that one person from Djibouti.

180 portraits will be shown throughout 2016 in local media to remind the Amsterdammers of the richness of their world. One thing that binds all Amsterdammers, native or imported, is that they feel free here. 180Amsterdammers is not just portraying faces but connecting people, cultures, thoughts, initiating dialogues and celebrating the richness of this great city-diversity through events, 

180 Amsterdammers is an initiative of Bridgizz and Younite in cooperation with Amsterdam Marketing, AmsterdamFM, the OBA (Amsterdam Public Library), the Amsterdam Museum, Het Parool daily newspaper, the Municipality of Amsterdam, Fotographer Michiel van Nieuwkerk and the designer Jacques Koeweiden
profile_positions.title: Co Founder & Author 180 Amsterdammers Book

profile_positions.description:
With Inclusive Algorithm, we want to raise awareness and inclusion among government, semi-government, public services, industry, education and other institutions (stakeholders) of the effects of algorithm decisions on vulnerable population groups. 

We do this by informing different groups with vulnerable population groups, involve, raise awareness and encourage concrete action, and also leveraging interconnections between stakeholders and the unreachable communities (mostly with migrant background).

We speak the language of the unconnected to be connected.
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description:
Lucreos (Lucas Creatives Osdorp) is an eco-friendly co-working space in Amsterdam. Formerly a old school, the space boasts high ceilings, classroom spaces and the furniture is made from reclaimed wood (wooden pallets).
We create a favorable platform for startups and growing businesses to connect with other (young) entrepreneurs and creatives for business, jobs, internships and other opportunities.
profile_positions.title: Founder

volunteer_experiences.description:
Mentoring of coaching the first cohorts of the U-Founders. U-Founders is a support structure for business creation, attached to Mohammed VI Polytechnic University in Ben Guerir, Morocco. 

It deploys incubation, pre-incubation and entrepreneurship awareness programs for students, researchers and entrepreneurs belonging to the university's ecosystem.

UM6P Explorer is a startup program developed by Mohammed VI Polytechnic University in collaboration with the MIT Sandbox Innovation Fund to provide students, researchers and aspiring entrepreneurs with access to entrepreneurial training, mentorship and potential funding opportunities.
MIT Sandbox provides seed funding for student-initiated entrepreneurial ideas, mentoring from within MIT and from a broad network of committed partners, and tailored educational experiences.

Afkar Incubator is a 6 months program, based in Tunis, that aims to support new leaders of social change. Its targets are the entrepreneurs and the entrepreneurial-minded who will be leading the change of tomorrow. 
https://www.linkedin.com/company/afkarincubator/

volunteer_experiences.role: Expert and Jury member Google.Org GIS (Impact Challenge on Safety)
volunteer_experiences.description: Expert panel member of Google.org Impact Challenge on Safety (GIC). It's a €10M fund  supporting organisations throughout Europe who are working on challenges related to hate, extremism, and child safety, both online and offline.

The Members Council Amsterdam influences and monitors the course of the Local Member Rabobank and forms the link to the bank’s broad member basis. It performs an influential, sounding board, advisory and control role and serves as the linking pin between the broad member basis on the one hand and the bank on the other.

The members council’s activities accordingly include adopting the financial statements and appointing the members of the local Supervisory Board.

To bring positive development in cities (Starting with Molenbeek Brussels) to contribute to cohesion and fight fear by bringing people's diversity 2gether by a sportive challenge: Play&Peace. Connecting people for a common goal, develop dialogue and contribute towards the concept of ‘unity in diversity’ through combined actions on sports.

The Cruyff Court Molenbeek is realized thanks to the perseverance and commitment of Unico van Kooten and Ahmed Larouz of PlayandPeace. After the attacks in Brussels and the death of Johan Cruijff two days later, they have brought together partners to make their dream come true: creating a Cruyff Court. Together with the Rotary, the business community and the municipality of Saint-Jeans-Molenbeek the challenge is ultimately completed.

Morocco Fund is an independent organization established in partnership with NCDO (Dutch expertise and advisory center for citizenship and international cooperation.) in 2005. 
The Fund  is committed to the implementation of the Millennium Development Goals through supporting different initiatives and financing projects in Morocco.

Savan organises every year Beeld voor Beeld Fetival. BvB is a documentary film festival dealing with cultural diversity. In 2014, we will be celebrating our 25th anniversary. Rooted in visual anthropology, the festival screens documentaries on various (sub-)cultures in a format combining screenings, discussions and seminars on different themes. It offers a meeting place for filmmakers and audiences from different cultural backgrounds. 
Savan also organizes Cineblend. Cineblend is a monthly (networking) evening with dinner, film and debate focusing on perception and imaging of cultures in the Dutch media and is often linked to the current social issues.

A unique tradition Dutch 4-5 May holidays
Remembrance Day and Liberation Day
The Netherlands has its own way of commemorating World War II and celebrating the country’s liberation from five years of occupation. Unlike most countries, the Netherlands sets aside two days to mark these events. May 4 is a day of solemn commemoration. On May 5 we not only celebrate Holland’s liberation from the German occupation but also cherish freedom and democracy worldwide.

MENA400 is designed to reposition the debate on relations between the East and the West and to enhance the positive aspects of these relationships that are too often weakly or not treated. Indeed, it is an interactive platform for both regions to benefit from their respective strengths and pool their assets in various areas such as economics and development, sports, creative industries and arts and culture.

Network of High Educated Diaspora in The Netherlands. With more than 2000 members, was TANS one of the largest young diaspora networks in The Netherlands and Europe. 
Co founded in 1997 and chair from 2000 till 2006.
